overview: SPICE (Simple Protocol for Independent Computing Environments) is a remote display system that provides a way for virtualized guests to interact with a host. The SPICE server facilitates the sharing of USB devices, audio, video, and more between a guest and a host system. It enables high-quality interactive remote desktop experiences for virtual machines.
core_features: Allows sharing of USB devices, audio, and video
Facilitates high-quality interactive remote desktop experiences
Enhances virtual machine interaction with the host system
